com.qualcomm.snapdragon.sdk.gestures

Class OverlayView

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qualcomm.snapdragon.sdk.gestures.OverlayView
  • Deprecated.

    @Deprecated
public class OverlayView
extends java.lang.Object
    This class starts and sends intents to an overlay service that will show above anything else on a particular screen. It is used to create some custom gesture functionality. The overlay service may or may not exist on the system. If the service does not exist, nothing happens. If the service is available on the system, this class will broadcast intents that the service will handle.

      • turnOn

        @Deprecated
public void turnOn(boolean bShowArrows)
        Deprecated. 
        Show the overlay. This will bring up a custom UI that shows what you are able to do with gestures.
        Parameters:
        bShowArrows - True if the arrows should appear as part of the overlay, false otherwise

      • turnOff

        @Deprecated
public void turnOff()
        Deprecated. 
        Turns off the overlay. It will remove any UI elements from the screen.

      • updateEngagement

        @Deprecated
public void updateEngagement(double percentEngaged,
                               boolean bShowArrows)
        Deprecated. 
        Engagement percentage has changed. This is used to give visual feedback for engagement detection and amount of detection.
        Parameters:
        percentEngaged - The current value of the engagement. 0 means there is no detection and 100 means there is full detection. This is the engaged state.
        bShowArrows - True if we want to brig up the arrows once engagement is > 20% percent, false otherwise.
